content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is a game where you can do almost anything you want more freedom than most games can offer though it still has much progress the little time i played ive had loads of fun their are many pros and cons thoughPROS:-Many chracter beginnings many ones such as freedom seekers,cannibal hunters,nobodies,old soldier and a few more-Character creation is nice needs more in depth creation hopefully another race such as mutants or something cool if there will be deserts and oceans(there is only human male and female)-Good fighting,excellent animation with connection of blades and armor-Challeging,this game requires much though on what you should do with a specific person and how to defeat a bandit party without having everyone becoming injured-Graphics are nice -Ability to stop time and look at surroundings is nice-Good weapons and armor designs-you get to build a base CONS:-Frequent crashes like i said its still in alpha so give it time and report problems-Not enough weapon/armor choices,there should be more i reccomend no guns though could add bows too not just crossbows and dual blades and hopefully shields-Base resources take forever(do not recommend starting out building base at all unless you pick one of the starting choices which have info on it)-watch for your charcters being stuck-weird trading system or merchants dont travel into outpost or leave the shop or outpostOverrall rating is a 8.5/10 very good game nice structure,gameplay,nice graphics,good rts style gameplay if wanted and need be. DO NOT FORGET!!!!!!!!>>> Its still in alpha so give it time and try it its definatly worth the money

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is a very interesting game.  Its very fun.  It has great RPG elements.  Survival-like mechanics.  You can build up an army.  Become a trader.  The game is a blast.  The game is not very face paced just to make that known.  Its about taking your time and making a real faction/nation.  When i first got the game i loved it.  But it was a very long time ago and it was in very early access, so it lacked in content and got boring.  But now with all of its updates and with the workshop, this game really feels like a game.  I rate it a 8/10.  It drops the two points because its still early access of course and its controls can be difficult at times.  But overall this is a great and fun game!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26
Early Access Review
								I picked this game up a year ago and while there were a few annoying bugs(now fixed) it was an enjoyable game that was exactly as stated a free world squad based rpg... where you're not somehow special without working at it, and when trying to take on a bandit... they have friends.   I started playing again this year and the bugs had all been fixed.  The game had made actual progress unlike so many early access and it plays and feels like a complete game already.  This is the first early access game i've played where full price or more seems justified, rather than waiting for a sale.  The obvious interest and tangible updates by the developers is encouraging and I can't even imagine what else they will add to make it a finished product.  There is even the option for different difficulty levels by altering the world dynamics, and different optional starting squad compositions, anything from a small team with the materials to start a base, to the lone scavenger trying to survive the wasteland and find a few friends. (one note is that i'd recommend taking a look at some of the mods after the first few hours of experience to potentially reduce grind)

Early Access Review
								(Due to bad internet, I've got much less hours on record than I've actually played)I'm updating my review, which was made in 2014.I still recommend this game. Since my purchase of it, it has been updated, patched onto and received many additions. That, however, does not make it complete, or stable.What are you getting right now?The game is a survival sandbox-rpg where you command a squad of people with different skills and attributes, you can build in a vast, albeit a bit empty (a new map is coming, so... not an issue), desert land; mine; trade; hunt for bandits, for trade caravans; research and manufacture an assortment of products, from food, to booze, to katanas, to chain mail.There are several cities and settlements, a couple of factions, ranging from bandits to the holy nation, to cannibals, and slavers.As it is, the game is filled with half implemented features, grayed-out options, bugs and optimization issues and, basically, room for improvement.It also comes with a lot of things to do, from building a fort, to making a ton of money from trade, to beating the ever living crap out a bandit boss who wanted to threaten you and sticking him in a cage, only to then hand him in to some samurai police dude.tldrThe game is not ready, but has been being updated, and, overall, has improved since my acquisition of it. In addition, it is great fun to have such a degree of freedom in a game, and I have full confidence in the developers and their commitment to their product, which is key to an early access game.If anything, the year and a half I've had with this game taught me that regardless of the goals the devs set themselves, they seem quite capable of achieving it, should you give them time.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								In an earlier state of the game when I first bought it, I wanted to build a base really bad. I chose to build it somewhat close to a dogs den on a hill, next to the mountain because it looked like a defensible location. I thought it was far enough from the dog's aggro range.I was wrong. Day after day, dogs practically rushed up the hill and murdered my squad in their sleep. Sometimes, it rained dogs on top of my squad member's heads. One @#$%ing dog could completely destroy my whole squad, even with some  members clad in heavy plate armor. Just to build a well, they even had to go on stealth mode for fear of alerting the dogs.After constant fighting and brushes with death, my squad members survived and grew stronger. There were times when I had them running up the hill with huge backpacks packed with heavy ores, concrete bricks and water buckets just to train their strength.Eventually, I had at least 3 warriors on par with a samurai lord, and could solo sweep the entire murderous dog's den on their own. I was unrivalled across much of the land of Kenshi, and even won a battle with an entire city's worth of "policemen". Good times.Based on past experiences, I recommend building your base next to a monster spawn.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a game I've been following and playing for a VERY long time.  One of my first GL games, I loved the idea, the setting, and the core mechanics.  And while development seems to have been taking FOREVER (seriously, it's been in my library for over 2 years or so) it's actually been progressing very quickly, I'm just impatient.TL;DRVery realistic approach to an RPG game.  Nice open sandbox elements (done well so far), good combat elements that are in need of some slight refining but are otherwise well thoughtout and implemented, and the possibility to build your own bases/towns to form your own "faction" is great.Pros:+Everything?  Seriously, there are so many elements to this game it would be impossible to list them in the limit that Steam puts on reviews.+Music is good, not great, but immersive enough that it doesn't distract+Graphics are good, nothing AAA here, but the rest is so well done who the hell cares?+Gameplay: so without being able to go into too much detail because there's not enough room, they've done a great job with the entire concept of "play how you want" within the confines of the game and it's world.  Theivery, trading, combat, research and technology (which goes along with), base building, and the FIGHTING!!!!+Combat is good, since it's still in beta, I'm hoping they refine a few things that are buggy/problematic (Yes, stagger, I mean you, you annoying ♥♥♥♥♥!).Cons:-Still buggy, lots of crashing issues (still a beta so this is hardly a complaint, just a problem that in it's current state may detract from some people's enjoyment-UI is a little odd, in that it doesn't fit the game's aesthetics, but it's far from awful-Load times! But they're still working on optimising the game, so another item that will hopefully fall off the list (but needs to be stated for anyone currently looking at the title)-Some combat elements (staggering is a HUGE problem IMO), though this is purely an OPINION on the current balance they have for the game that I feel doesn't fit to wellIn-Depth:So I can't fit it all in here, there's so many good things to say about this game, but it's a great title.  They really took the whole sandbox combat RPG thing and just created something so spectacular.  You can almost literally do whatever you want.  Seriously.  The way things are done is super realistic (as much as you can in a game like this, anyways), from combat, to research and base building, to farming and trading, right down to the injuries people sustain and how it affects their movements!  You'll limp with a busted up leg, or cradle that beaten up arm, or hold your head so your brains don't fall out from that gaping hole you just got!  Ok, not THAT detailed, but you hold your head when it's injured!  That level of detail is downright impressive from even a AAA title!This team has done some really amazing work, and they deserve some major props, praise and a whole lot of cats... er, I mean cash!  I can't wait to see this game finished, polished, and then what they come up with next!

content:
Posted: March 25
Early Access Review
								-->>I would suggest turing down mouse sensitivity and scroll speeds to aid in performance.<<--TL:DR Buy Kenshi if you're into this sort of epic Post Apocalypitic Survial RTS RPG. I say epic because to truly become a master or rule the world of Kenshi, you will have invested likely a thousand hours; provided you don't cheat, or use the variuous mods which change the typical way you train your fighting skills.I played Kenshi years ago when the extremly early alpha was free on the now bought out Desura. I can tell you the game has really pulled through on that initial vision, and I can't be happier for the developer. Kenshi has come to life.You can literally go from a broke, naked, and incredibly weak; to a mighty warrior wrecking groups of foes and ruler of all the lands. You can build an empire / trade / steal / fight cannibals and other exotic creatures. You can participate in the slave trade or be captured as a slave yourself.The post apocalyptic world is vast (F'ing HUGE) and beautiful. It makes you wonder about the past fallen civilizations and what took place to cause the fall. I think the less you know about Kenshi when you start, the more awe struck you will be upon discovering the world of Kenshi. Don't watch let's plays, just go in blind and you'll be happy that you did. Easily hundreds of hours of gameplay await you. Surviving is difficult and managing a large settlement is also difficult, as it should be.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								This Is a really amazing game that I love playing! From being able to start out completelty hopeless in a extremely dangerous desert where you can die within contact of any hostile NPC's. To the awesome level up system for your people. However the game needs work. I haven't played more than 10 hours of this game yet and already notice many things wrong with the game. I will help out by making a list of problems.1) After closing hours of shops your person can get trapped in stores over night2) Game crashes constantly  3) Random spawning of NPC's (litterally had a beaked giraffe or whatever it is spawn right in front of me)4) The pathfinding is slightly broken and causes your people to loop around building before they acctually go into the one you want)5) Textures could use a lot more work! (And I mean A LOT)6) When youn reload the game the squad hotkey at the bottom screen does not display your characters and makes you restart the game to see it again.7) There is no home menu option when you pause the game, WTF!8) Characters and NPC's can walk strait through furniture9) When your on the ground bleeding out in the middle of a town, none of the NPC's help you (This isn't really a bug or anything but come on you know it needs to be part of the game) 10) Help menu seems to be very outdatedI will update this if I run into anymore problems. But I highly recomend this game it has crazy potential to it!

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is definatly one of the most satisfying games that I have ever played. Some people might see this as a negative, but the game plops you in a random location and lets you do whatever you want. No quest line, no objectives, your only job is to survive. It's also nice that you don't start the game as some kind of "chosen one" the fact that you have to build yourself up from the bottom is what makes this game so satisfying. Though the game has been in development for some years, I have seen that the devs have been dedicated in thier work and have made a lot of progress. I eagery wait for the game's full release. If you want a game that doesn't hold your hand, that gives you total freedom to do whatever you want, I totally recomend this game.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								Lots of pottential for this game, there are some crashes and some minor or game breaking bugs but this is still a early access game, the game mechanics are easily adaptable to and easy to figure out.RTS/RPG/Survival/OpenWorld/CityBuid is basicly all the tags for this game if you wanted to see what its like.Graphics are decent for a game like this, The amount of characters you can have(30 Max.) is very useful if you want to have a Trading Caravan. Bandit/ninja party, Small Town, Doctors, or anything you wish, there is different roles and scenarios you are able to play like, a lone wanderer who has nothing, a hungover ninja who got into a bad situation, or a lucky scavenger who found a OP sword but has people out to get him. Survival is constant as there are animals everywhere trying to devour you, slavers trying to capture you or canibals trying to eat you and bandits of all sorts trying to rob you and kill you or the ninjas that have no real reason to kill you but theyll just try to do it anyways. There are many Factions throughout the lad of Kenshi including your own faction, you can improve or worsen relations with different factions, make freinds, enemies, have new members join, hire medics, engineers, nobodies or experienced fighters to join your faction. there are many jobs within kenshi like bounty hunting, farming, mining, crafting, water gathering,hauling,and just so much more to come....i do really recommend this game but you should probably wait until a few more patches and updates to come beacsue the crashes are really crazy and it usually crashes after a autosave or when you load the game the squad system is broken...but i do reccomend this game because it hasnt given me that much trouble other than lag and crashes.

								Kenshi is a game where you can do almost anything you want more freedom than most games can offer though it still has much progress the little time i played ive had loads of fun their are many pros and cons thoughPROS:-Many chracter beginnings many ones such as freedom seekers,cannibal hunters,nobodies,old soldier and a few more-Character creation is nice needs more in depth creation hopefully another race such as mutants or something cool if there will be deserts and oceans(there is only human male and female)-Good fighting,excellent animation with connection of blades and armor-Challeging,this game requires much though on what you should do with a specific person and how to defeat a bandit party without having everyone becoming injured-Graphics are nice -Ability to stop time and look at surroundings is nice-Good weapons and armor designs-you get to build a base CONS:-Frequent crashes like i said its still in alpha so give it time and report problems-Not enough weapon/armor choices,there should be more i reccomend no guns though could add bows too not just crossbows and dual blades and hopefully shields-Base resources take forever(do not recommend starting out building base at all unless you pick one of the starting choices which have info on it)-watch for your charcters being stuck-weird trading system or merchants dont travel into outpost or leave the shop or outpostOverrall rating is a 8.5/10 very good game nice structure,gameplay,nice graphics,good rts style gameplay if wanted and need be. content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								** Return player from very early alpha, back in the days of just desert and luring bandits to guards**Spawn in Holy Nation farm.Oh there is now hunger systemWhere to find food? Holy Nation might not be happy if they lose a few cows at the farmOh look a silly little dog is barking and running towards meSo innocent looking, little did it know that it is a free dinner being deliverd to meCome here nice doggie! Come and pla-aaaaaarrghhh!!..........!@#$%!!I was the free dinner delivered to him...  You call THAT a "dog"??!!?  I swear that's a fxxxin' lion in a dog's skinBarely survived, stumbled into town on the one half good leg, one broken arm dangling uselessly by the side.Oh new buildings and shops, that's cool! I wonder what's inside this next big building. Barrack! They have training dummies! That will get my fighting skill up!Everyone seem very excited, running towards me, what a warm welcome! Is this also a new feature?"You shouldn't be in here!" "Get out!" "Paladin!"Recovers from black out episode, found self in jail, weapon confiscatedSo trespassing is a thing now??   Well at least I was right about this being a new feature...At least  Toughness leveled up Hmm no one cares if I try to lockpick the jail from inside, even the guard just stands there and watch.  Thievery leveled up. Well lockpicking was easy, and no one cared. Wonder if they care if I just walk out?Yes they cared.  Toughness leveled up again. Found an opportunity with bandit and "dog" raid keeping guards busy, bailed.Starvation kicking in. Oh look, ribs showing, character is literally skin and bones! Nice new featureWow food is not cheap..  maybe a bit of hard work with iron mining outside to earn my food, while waiting for bounty to expireIron dirt cheap compared to food. Rage quit.Stumbled up second storey of bar, guard decided to take a tea break from his dutyTime to try out this new stealth feature.  Instantly overloaded with food.No! some guy walked up, he's going to spot the stealing. Oh wait what's this, "stealth KO" option?Guy's face on the floor instantly, amazing. Keep loading with food. Nom nom. Hunger, what's that?Getting overloaded, need to sell some stuff for $$. Conveniently shop keeper just downstairs. Stealth outside shop, no one noticed, walked back in tall and proud. No one cared. Time to sell to the shopkeeperWait how do you know these food belonged to you? Did you install microchips inside all of them?  Toughness leveled up. A lot. Finally out of prison. Thank god for stealth KO, within a few nights have multiple backpacks in backpacks filled with "free samples" of items from every shop in town. Need storage.Became proud owner of a bull - aka mobile storage device & amazing aoe damage dealer to hungry bandits. Discovered the Hub. Instant millionaire. Time to start playing Kenshi, the "squad" based RPG TLDR: so many good stories to tell, not enough review space to write. A unique sandbox type of its own. Features that are particularly different from other sandbox games include: characters don't always die (instead rendered unconscious) when they lose battle; getting beaten up and losing battle is actually good for characfter development (hence discouraging save scumming when you "screw up"). Physical appearance improvement as characters improve their stat - you can tell which one is the seasoned veteran. RTS strategies - kite enemies, put aside a little squad to rescue your fallen teammates and bring them to safe place to bandage up and rest..... The list goes on.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								** Return player from very early alpha, back in the days of just desert and luring bandits to guards**Spawn in Holy Nation farm.Oh there is now hunger systemWhere to find food? Holy Nation might not be happy if they lose a few cows at the farmOh look a silly little dog is barking and running towards meSo innocent looking, little did it know that it is a free dinner being deliverd to meCome here nice doggie! Come and pla-aaaaaarrghhh!!..........!@#$%!!I was the free dinner delivered to him...  You call THAT a "dog"??!!?  I swear that's a fxxxin' lion in a dog's skinBarely survived, stumbled into town on the one half good leg, one broken arm dangling uselessly by the side.Oh new buildings and shops, that's cool! I wonder what's inside this next big building. Barrack! They have training dummies! That will get my fighting skill up!Everyone seem very excited, running towards me, what a warm welcome! Is this also a new feature?"You shouldn't be in here!" "Get out!" "Paladin!"Recovers from black out episode, found self in jail, weapon confiscatedSo trespassing is a thing now??   Well at least I was right about this being a new feature...At least  Toughness leveled up Hmm no one cares if I try to lockpick the jail from inside, even the guard just stands there and watch.  Thievery leveled up. Well lockpicking was easy, and no one cared. Wonder if they care if I just walk out?Yes they cared.  Toughness leveled up again. Found an opportunity with bandit and "dog" raid keeping guards busy, bailed.Starvation kicking in. Oh look, ribs showing, character is literally skin and bones! Nice new featureWow food is not cheap..  maybe a bit of hard work with iron mining outside to earn my food, while waiting for bounty to expireIron dirt cheap compared to food. Rage quit.Stumbled up second storey of bar, guard decided to take a tea break from his dutyTime to try out this new stealth feature.  Instantly overloaded with food.No! some guy walked up, he's going to spot the stealing. Oh wait what's this, "stealth KO" option?Guy's face on the floor instantly, amazing. Keep loading with food. Nom nom. Hunger, what's that?Getting overloaded, need to sell some stuff for $$. Conveniently shop keeper just downstairs. Stealth outside shop, no one noticed, walked back in tall and proud. No one cared. Time to sell to the shopkeeperWait how do you know these food belonged to you? Did you install microchips inside all of them?  Toughness leveled up. A lot. Finally out of prison. Thank god for stealth KO, within a few nights have multiple backpacks in backpacks filled with "free samples" of items from every shop in town. Need storage.Became proud owner of a bull - aka mobile storage device & amazing aoe damage dealer to hungry bandits. Discovered the Hub. Instant millionaire. Time to start playing Kenshi, the "squad" based RPG TLDR: so many good stories to tell, not enough review space to write. A unique sandbox type of its own. Features that are particularly different from other sandbox games include: characters don't always die (instead rendered unconscious) when they lose battle; getting beaten up and losing battle is actually good for characfter development (hence discouraging save scumming when you "screw up"). Physical appearance improvement as characters improve their stat - you can tell which one is the seasoned veteran. RTS strategies - kite enemies, put aside a little squad to rescue your fallen teammates and bring them to safe place to bandage up and rest..... The list goes on.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is shaping up to be one of the best games on Steam and maybe one of the best games out. Period.A very ambitious design, Kenshi is real time and looks like these game makers are trying to succeed at giving players squad based combat, base building, base defense, factions warfare and relations, character development and excellent customization, rescource management, serious exploration, rich atmosphere, and in depth game play mechanics like stealth and lockpicking. Thats just to name a few game play elements Kenshi is aiming to offer players. Ambitious or what.Kenshi's story is weak at the moment and there are a few bugs but the updates are rapid, like once or twice a week. Alot is unfinished and buggy, but its in alpha. This is a game that I expect the price to rise when it is launched.Check it out for sure. Theres a free demo even. This could potentially be a 10/10 game some day. Really. As it is now, in alpha, with so much unfinished its easily a 7/10. I expect pro reviews will be just as flattering.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I've put many hours into this game.  Though it's still in it's early alpha stage, the game is coming along nicely for what it is currently.The concept is fresh, and is executed very well.  The detail puts many AAA games to shame, even in it's current state.  I'd highly recommend this to anyone that loves RPG's, strategy games, and squad based combat in a real-time setting with pause mechanic.There are flaws with the game, that are unfortunately due to the engine used but it's being updated and as of writing this review, 0.72.1 is really buggy and crashes.  I have set it to experimental which means it's the unstable variant of the game and as I stated it is buggy.  There currently is a limitation in the engine that causes a specific crash that tends to happen often, unfortunatly though they haven't pinpointed it yet but I have faith they will soon.  Other flaws, which are very minor, are glitches with pathing and AI mainly.  It's not optimized so it's very slow at times even on high end machines.  Aside from these flaws the game is very much playable and extremely fun despite missing many of the mechanics the developers have in store for the game.They have many additions in store for the game, new races, new biomes, a HUGE map, lots of buildings to build, and many more we have yet to hear about.Again I recommend this to anyone that loves chaotic fast paced battles.  I'm looking very much forward to the finished product.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 5, 2013
Early Access Review
								Alright time to update finaly got sound, cannibals, and females in game. Isn't even to .7 yet is playable to a large degree. There are still some bugs running around but it is not a finished game if you don't expect bugs well you haven't played games in the last 10 years. I still remember plain xbox games that had bugs and you were stuck with them, the first time my xbox 360 patched a game I was in awe of the tech, then a year latter I wass annoyed at having to wait 2 mins for bug fixes, that use to be stuck with for life.You can't go solo some bandits for exp instead your running like coward dragging bandits into gaurds, and looting other peoples kills. Or my fave trying to gather enough to kill a trade caravan or at least just the weaker traders, so you can loot their backpacks full of goodies, and once their guards clean up, you look for a bandit leader, strip him naked, heal him pick up and collect his bounty at the nearest town lol.You can now start a outpost early and work on your own little prodution empire, but beware doing so means a lot of running since the start that lets you do so doesn't have any real armor, weapons, or skilled fighters so you will get chased out of your outpost on accasion. Much better to assemble your own team and train in the desert while buying goods low, and selling high between towns. That way you are attached to your men/women there not just worker 1-6 you know them by name. Of course you do end up hireing worker 1-6 still but they are just production fodder, the crew you trained from scratch are their gaurdians and masters, who can work along side them in time of peace. To me it isn't just about making my own outpost and sitting in it waiting for traders to come and buy my goods, its about the adventure, going out of the outpost taking on the cannibals, and bandits. Using the base to research a means to craft high quality gear, and train old worker bees into soliders to assit my core team in picking fights with people who use to mop the floor with me.And next up on the roadmap diplomacy, making it so factions interact with you. Especialy nice for the people who turtle up in the outpost and never leave, they will have to deal with demmands, raids and the nicer things that goes with faction interaction

content:
Posted: June 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								First things first, this game is a gem. It's a squad based sandbox building game with a cool world and lots of rewarding levelling and progression. Even with minimal dialogue you will feel attached toe ach and every one of your squad members more and more as you go along. Now for the downside, this game is a long time coming, and is being developed LITERALLY by one guy. Progress is slow but it's always making progress. This game is well done, and while there are some bugs it's potential is limitless. If you like independent game development, and this sounds even mildly entertaining to you, buy this game. It's cheap and it supports original, independent game development.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is one of those games I go back to every couple of months.  Every time it's a different experience, but that core aspect is still there: "Whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger."  I laugh sometimes at the strategies I come up with.  "perhaps getting my butt kicked daily as a slave will be a good endurance grind..."  I keep a special post-disaster savegame named Whatthehelljusthappened for when I get suprised and I use it often.The developers are very ambitious.  They had a great base game going, then they threw out the map with the experimental version, and replaced it with a huge continent.  Only about 1/8th of the new map is available for play right now and I'm simply amazed at the detail that was put into it.  They added animals and creatures out of nightmare.  Different humaniods, religious motivations, pets, crime and punishment.  There are still lots of bugs to get ironed out.  CTD is common, but with a decent autosave, it hasn't ruined the game for me.

content:
Posted: June 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has a lot of potential, however I am not sure they will take it on. Early game: Early game last a very long time, partially because it is difficult to get skilled out of early game.This part of the game is boring, repitition and grants no sense of doing anything.  You go find a group of baddies, lead them to town, help the guards fight (if you call it help), loot and sell, buy guys and gear, repeat for hours.Mid game: After you have enough guys, lets say 20 to be safe, you can buy up a bunch of building material, find a spot and start your own town.  Hopefully you can win about 20-30% of the fights by now.  This is where the game starts to get interesting finally.  Unfortunately I started this too soon, unable to actually win most fights makes my 12 guys unable to hold up my base.Short of it:  The game is as grindy as an MMO, but makes winning more difficult at first.  Based on the description, I believe it will become too easy late in game, if I could get to that point.  Thus I believe the mid-game is about the only part with any play value, considering how long it takes to get to that point I would not suggest starting again with a new goal unless you like watching guards grind.  With the description by the Developer the world will not change, hense long game you'll be so tough it will be boring from the lack of challenge.  This is why I don't believe the game will ever reach it's potential, and why I cannot recommend it.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								To begin, i know there has been some critical negative reviews, and i would like to explain them.The game has been in development for a long time, but when it was on indiegogo in 2012, it raised $2,315 dollars, when they wanted $40,000. So development is not going to be quick until their revenue.Since then, ive seen a vast improvement in the game, the development has really sped up in the last 12 months, as there is now a larger dev team and they can afford to focus on different aspects of the game.Now onto the game itself:Pros:-Game is definitely playable now, with alot to do, and a variety of things to aim for.-Can be modded easily (if so inclined), to increase the content and improve the game, although it doesnt need to be if you dont want to.-Immensely enjoyable, you can start in nearly any situation, as a single guy with a broken arm and a iron club,as a dedicated group of people ready to build a dream city, and plenty of other options.-The dev team regularly react to forum suggestions, and you can often see a direct impact of uploading crash reports.-Only £13-Alot of options of how to play, and there is something to do at the early, middle and late stages of the game. Starting an outpost, building up a core group of fighters, and then maybe even starting a war of sorts with some of the cities.-Everyone can level up in the game, the NPCS will get stronger if they fight, you can get stronger by winning (and sometimes losing) fights. -Nothing is guaranteed. There is a chance, albeit a slim one, that you can beat someone much stronger than you, as long as you get a lucky shot in. But that works in reverse, you could be KO'd by a hobo bandit when you can usually take on 10 of them, if they get a lucky shot.-However, my favourite feature is this: You are not special. You are not unique. If you fight someone stronger like you, you are not going to win very often. When you start, everyone, even the hobo bandits with rags and iron clubs, will easily beat you in a fight. But because of how some character stats work, this isnt neccesarily a bad thing, as by being beaten up, you improve, you build up a defence, and become harder to beat up next time. Fast forward abit, and you can easily kill a hobo bandit.In the view of being unbias:Cons:-Alpha game, so expect bugs, expect the game to lag and glitch out occasionally, and sometimes to crash completely. But by making use of the Autosave function, i've managed to make it so i rarely lose much progress. (I also sometimes use the crashes as a cue to stop playing, since you can get sucked into played for along time.)-Potentially long waits if you are beaten up in a fight, on max speed, i sometimes have to wait a minute or two for my guys to wake up after a knock out, which can get a little annoying, but i guess its a motivator to become stronger and not get beaten up.-Sometimes slow development. As i explained earlier, the development was slow for the first few years, but now due to a big dev team, it has sped up significantly. However, when new features are added, new bugs arise, sometimes making the game unplayable. This is usually resolved within a few days, and is sped up by uploading your crash reports to the forum.I cant think of any more cons. It seems bias, but thats because there are more pros than cons.I hope this has helped you make a decision, and just think: If you're worried about slow development, buy the game, and your money will help to fund it, causing development to speed up.Thanks for your time.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Broken beyond belief.What most say is that it's hard to get into, but what I say is that it's easy and welcomming to start out but the further you go, the more issues you'll see.It's in its core a cool game: Open world, do what you wish to do, no boundries set ... kinda . BUT it isn't. You're bound to the limitations of the engine itself, not the world, and besides several crashes while exploring (This one has big issues with memory leaks) it turns out to be a sure chore to play because of lacking gameplay options and bad AI.Let's do a quick Pros and Cons list, shall wePros:-Sim's like gameplay, where you chose what each of your crewmates do in a specific order-RTS type gameplay where you order you band of survivors by a drag and command interface-Promotes a Macro gameplayCons:-The AI often get stuck in a loop even if you've given them clear priority orders-You'll be doing a lot of pausing to control everything, or waiting for loads-Shallow and uninspiring world -A LOT and I mean a LOT of micromangement-Squad based RPG they said .. so how come my sqaud can't move in formation? Fast characters run ahead, get in trouble while the resque team is minutes away.- Start out as a weakling, and I mean WEAKLING. The normar 'Kill rats to get experience' would be to much of a challange in this game- Combat is boring as ... as boring as it gets. Stagger locks galore... you're the one being staggered... by naked guys with sticks- Graphics despite the engine requirements are BAD and sounds are almost none excistentLong story short .. Pretty much unplayable at this moment. Might get better, might get fun. As of now? Avoid!

								I think this game deserves all the support it can get.  In it's current form, there's not too much to do.  It's glitchy.  Sometimes you start off the game and NPCs are sky high and weapons slowly bury themselves into the desert just to make the game even harder.  And dead ally NPCs never disappear from your HUD.  Sometimes you put down an injured ally and suddenly they fly 10,000 meters northwest.  Yet this review isn't supposed to dissuade you from purchasing Kenshi.  These bugs are being thoroughly adressed, ableit slowly, and the creator really seems to have a passion and committment to his game.My opinion is that Greenlight is the worst thing to ever happen to Steam, it's flooded my beloved platform with CRAP.  I'm thankful that Kenshi made it through Greenlight and is one of the few redeeming releases in the sea of turds released from Greenshit.  It looks to be a great RPG, though I have my doubts whether the all the auspiciously planned features will be available, I have full confidence that Kenshi will be a fully fledged, fully fleshed out, vast and enjoyable game.Please buy it, try it, and support the dev team with crash logs.  They seem to really care and try.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								I purchased this game over a year ago, and it's been fun to see how the game has progressed. Kenshi has a special place in my heart as it was my first Early Access game, and it gave way to a horrible EA addiction; My personal views on the game: -Being Early Access there are a number of bugs, but the majority of them are so minor as to not be noticed and tend to be fixed quickly. Overall I've only come across one bug that caused me to quit playing, but it caused me to quit for a number of months. Recently however I decided to give it another try, and I'm very happy I did, the work that the Devs have done have been amazing, and the bug had been fixed. -The Gameplay is quite fun, albeit can be slow to get into at the start of a game, and the premise is unique, which I appriciate. -Once the initial slow start was over I found the game to be fairly immersive, creating seperate squads, each with its own purpose, town building, guards, labor, craftsmen, bounty hunters etc.-The Graphic are pretty good, and have improved significantly in the year I've had the game.-Updates can come slowly, but so far have always been worth the wait.Overall, aside from the Early Access bugs, and the occasional crash Kenshi is one of my favorite games, and I highly recommend it, however, as with all Early Access games, if you're looking for a finished game, this isn't it.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								TL;DR: The game hasn't changed much over several years, and is full of game breaking bugs with a UI that leaves the user confused. I cannot recommend the game at this point, and from what I have obversed over the years, I will most likely never recommend it.Bought the game in 2013. I played it a little bit but grew bored of it very quick. The UI was confusing to say the least. The game itself was full of many bugs. Animations didn't look good at all, often looking robotic. Shoot forward to end of 2015, a few days away from 2016. The meat of the game hasnt changed at all. The gameplay gets stale very quickly, I havent even been able to do much due to the game constantly crashing and having so many freezes and bugs that it quickly deters me from even trying to play the game. The UI is very cluttered and not user friendly at all. Animations dont look different. While the game has improved slightly in some areas, I still find it to be incredibly unfinished, which is a shame because the premise of the game is very good, and I would love to play a user friendly, finished version of this, but at this current rate I dont think the game will ever be in a finished state.

								This game is absolutely obsurd. It promises sandbox game play? yea freaking right.  You are relegated to what amounts to be a 1 hit point character that get mobbed by 8-10 bandits if even think of leaving the city, you have no way to reliably defend yourself, training weapons takes forever! Seriously put your guy on auto attack ona dummy and go to sleep NOT FUN all skills are like that. The camera angles are wonky to say the least numerous buggs are still in effect for example I was returning a bandit leader to the police for a nice reward but they wouldnt take him so I put the bandit leader out and he immediately jumped up spawned some bad♥♥♥♥♥sword and took out the ENTIRE EFFING MILITIA apparently he was unkillable he then spawn camped me and any time i would wake up he would drive his sword through my skull. YAYA SO MUCH FUN! I managed to scrape together some materials and find a nice spot to set up camp but as soon as i did the bandits cam eout and demanded ransom which i couldnt pay and slaughtered my  one tiny shack. I bought this game on sale and its not worth it AT ALL GO SOMEWHERE ELSE even the origianl X-com wasnt this brutal. all your stats start at level 1 and any recruit you get also starts at level 1 so it will take you roughly a week to get any momentum up if you can survive the first 2-3 hours that is if your going to make yoru characters one shot kills to everything you need to have them advnace a lot faster than they currently are or SOMEWAY to buy a mercenary that can take on 12 bandits at a time since all you do at the beggining is run out find bandits run back in train the town guard ont hem then loot thier corpses then walk at a snails pace back with the little gear you CAN CARRY and hope the gear doesnt despawn when you go back or hope the bandits dont wake up and run away.Weapons are worhtless seriously you made a ninja/samurai game WITHOUT ♥♥♥♥ING BOWS??? READ A BOOK YOU IMBICILE!!!! THe game world is to large for how fast you can travel on foot. Desperatley need horses since you know samurai tended to be MOUNTED ARCHERS YOU JACK♥♥♥♥♥ Finding your way around town is difficult some towns dont have every shop and when you cant buy a backpack your well and truly screwed. theres no minimap no directional heading so you cant find your way around easily, shops are incongruously marked, I've yet to survive more than 3 hours without the game bugging out and forcing a restart, so i can't even comment on the whole "Sand box building mode" Weapon damage and armor are the most INANE system i've ever seen WTF do these damn numbers EVEN MEAN???!!! THAC0 was ten times easier to figure out than this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥combat ystem.  Guys if you want a city builder go get banished its way better than this. I wanted to liek this game so much....I REALLY WANT TOLIKE YOU KENSHI BUT JESUS EFFING CHRIST ALL MIGHTY YOUR A BIGGER TURD THAN JABBA THE HUT!!!!so reasons NOT to bu this game via bullet point1. Character advancement monotonous, slow, underpowered, and to complex to easily understand2. Slow travel times bog a slow game down even more have fun crawling to town with your loot only to get jumped by bandits and killed.3. A single starting character VS 12 bandits right  off the bat run or die. YOu need to have a party of 8-10 chars starting to even try and survive.4. Unstable gameplay can screw over all your hard work and set you back several HOURS.5. awful camera controls.6. Tooltips?? LMAO WTF ARE THOSE7.NO ranged combat all melee seriously give me a godamn bow go read some japanese/chinese hostory8. ugly ugly ugly graphics characters hover about 2 feet off the ground such lazy programming. Character models are very unrefined and buggy. Often times when using a bed my character sleeps upside pwn with his feet sticking up under the pillow and his head poking into the ground.9. Sand box! you'll never make it there and even if you do you get overrun by bandits so unless you ahve hired 50 recruits dont even think about it. I'm sure it would be just as bad a grind fest as getting your character up to that point. Hmm let me research for 5 hours real time how to craft a SPOON!!!10. Absurd combat system crafted by some demented lovecraftian spawn of cthulu locked in a extra dimensional pocket of agony.11. absolute BARREN landscape you will spend most your time zoomed out to max range watching a monotone brown desert, looking for tiny pixes that resemble bandits so you can run your name close to them and then run away to town having the town guard do your dirty work loot as many things as you can and hope beyond hope you can make it to town again without getting jumped by another 20 fuggin bandits. this game isnt worth 5$ if this was a 2.17$ i'd still be more entertained by wiping my♥♥♥♥♥with the code this game dares to present. If you are looking for a sandbox game go elsewhere. if however you are looking for an INSANE CHALLENGE to both your wits, and patience as a human being then get this game as each bug and each death and each set back will make you tear your hair out asking why the EFF DO I PLAY THIS!!!! The only potential this game has is how far the well of dissapointment goes down. YOu have a choice...YOu can take the red pill or the blue pill......take the blue pill

content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is absolutely obsurd. It promises sandbox game play? yea freaking right.  You are relegated to what amounts to be a 1 hit point character that get mobbed by 8-10 bandits if even think of leaving the city, you have no way to reliably defend yourself, training weapons takes forever! Seriously put your guy on auto attack ona dummy and go to sleep NOT FUN all skills are like that. The camera angles are wonky to say the least numerous buggs are still in effect for example I was returning a bandit leader to the police for a nice reward but they wouldnt take him so I put the bandit leader out and he immediately jumped up spawned some bad♥♥♥♥♥sword and took out the ENTIRE EFFING MILITIA apparently he was unkillable he then spawn camped me and any time i would wake up he would drive his sword through my skull. YAYA SO MUCH FUN! I managed to scrape together some materials and find a nice spot to set up camp but as soon as i did the bandits cam eout and demanded ransom which i couldnt pay and slaughtered my  one tiny shack. I bought this game on sale and its not worth it AT ALL GO SOMEWHERE ELSE even the origianl X-com wasnt this brutal. all your stats start at level 1 and any recruit you get also starts at level 1 so it will take you roughly a week to get any momentum up if you can survive the first 2-3 hours that is if your going to make yoru characters one shot kills to everything you need to have them advnace a lot faster than they currently are or SOMEWAY to buy a mercenary that can take on 12 bandits at a time since all you do at the beggining is run out find bandits run back in train the town guard ont hem then loot thier corpses then walk at a snails pace back with the little gear you CAN CARRY and hope the gear doesnt despawn when you go back or hope the bandits dont wake up and run away.Weapons are worhtless seriously you made a ninja/samurai game WITHOUT ♥♥♥♥ING BOWS??? READ A BOOK YOU IMBICILE!!!! THe game world is to large for how fast you can travel on foot. Desperatley need horses since you know samurai tended to be MOUNTED ARCHERS YOU JACK♥♥♥♥♥ Finding your way around town is difficult some towns dont have every shop and when you cant buy a backpack your well and truly screwed. theres no minimap no directional heading so you cant find your way around easily, shops are incongruously marked, I've yet to survive more than 3 hours without the game bugging out and forcing a restart, so i can't even comment on the whole "Sand box building mode" Weapon damage and armor are the most INANE system i've ever seen WTF do these damn numbers EVEN MEAN???!!! THAC0 was ten times easier to figure out than this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥combat ystem.  Guys if you want a city builder go get banished its way better than this. I wanted to liek this game so much....I REALLY WANT TOLIKE YOU KENSHI BUT JESUS EFFING CHRIST ALL MIGHTY YOUR A BIGGER TURD THAN JABBA THE HUT!!!!so reasons NOT to bu this game via bullet point1. Character advancement monotonous, slow, underpowered, and to complex to easily understand2. Slow travel times bog a slow game down even more have fun crawling to town with your loot only to get jumped by bandits and killed.3. A single starting character VS 12 bandits right  off the bat run or die. YOu need to have a party of 8-10 chars starting to even try and survive.4. Unstable gameplay can screw over all your hard work and set you back several HOURS.5. awful camera controls.6. Tooltips?? LMAO WTF ARE THOSE7.NO ranged combat all melee seriously give me a godamn bow go read some japanese/chinese hostory8. ugly ugly ugly graphics characters hover about 2 feet off the ground such lazy programming. Character models are very unrefined and buggy. Often times when using a bed my character sleeps upside pwn with his feet sticking up under the pillow and his head poking into the ground.9. Sand box! you'll never make it there and even if you do you get overrun by bandits so unless you ahve hired 50 recruits dont even think about it. I'm sure it would be just as bad a grind fest as getting your character up to that point. Hmm let me research for 5 hours real time how to craft a SPOON!!!10. Absurd combat system crafted by some demented lovecraftian spawn of cthulu locked in a extra dimensional pocket of agony.11. absolute BARREN landscape you will spend most your time zoomed out to max range watching a monotone brown desert, looking for tiny pixes that resemble bandits so you can run your name close to them and then run away to town having the town guard do your dirty work loot as many things as you can and hope beyond hope you can make it to town again without getting jumped by another 20 fuggin bandits. this game isnt worth 5$ if this was a 2.17$ i'd still be more entertained by wiping my♥♥♥♥♥with the code this game dares to present. If you are looking for a sandbox game go elsewhere. if however you are looking for an INSANE CHALLENGE to both your wits, and patience as a human being then get this game as each bug and each death and each set back will make you tear your hair out asking why the EFF DO I PLAY THIS!!!! The only potential this game has is how far the well of dissapointment goes down. YOu have a choice...YOu can take the red pill or the blue pill......take the blue pill

content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Number 1, I happen to really like this game.  I purchased this game in Oct. 2014 and have spent over 318 hours trying to play it.  The constant crashes are the biggest complaint I have.  This game used to be semi playable and would stay operational for a couple of hours.  Sure it has been buggy with people sticking in walls and getting stuck inside buildings, etc., but it was playable.I do not know why the crashing problem has not been addressed but has been constantly ignored and instead other content of the game keeps getting added.    I stopped playing for a couple of months and waited patiently hoping that this problem would be taken care of in one of the patches.I have deleted all content and have reinstalled this game at least 2 dozen times.  Two days ago I decided to try and play again.  I reinstalled the game AGAIN so that all content would be new.  It allowed me to play a couple of hours then the crashes started once again.  On one crash it deleted all saved games and even the autosave game.I don't even mind my characters running backwards, I actually find it amusing and it doesn't stop them from operating machines or doing other duties assigned to them.   I check the integrity of the files and I seem to be losing 1-4 files every time after each crash.  Today my average game play time is 22 seconds before the game crashes.I really want to play this game, but 22 seconds between crashes is very infuriating even for someone with as much patience as I have shown towards this game.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								This was one of the very first games I ever bought in Early Access.  This game is part of the reason I avoid early access games like the corporatist plague they are. Raise Money! Fund Raising! Pump the Hype! Delivery at Minimal Cost! PROFITS!!!!!I am really sorry to see that this is becoming the norm for retail video games as it has become the norm in so many other aspects of our lives. Kenshi (and countless early access games now), is result of this system... The owners have no technical or legal mechanism to force them to complete the game in a quality or timely manner, and they have already had their money grab thanks to to Early Access and Steam. This game looks almost identical to what it looked like years ago when I bought it. Very little has changed in development. The question of whether or not is has "potential" is an excercise in futility when something has been around as long as Kenshi has.  The world is empty, there are no quests or missions, every NPC is identical with the exception that a few of them start the game hostile to each other. There really just isn't anything here, and until the game is released and the reviews start to change, iI would avoid this like a waste of money it is.You will probably get 10-15 hours of playability out of it in its current state. This is about how much time it takes to run through the research tree, level some characters, and get some production going.  Over the years as it has been updated modestly i have done a few play throughs (I refuse to not get my money out of it).

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game has more potential than anything I have seen on Greenlight/Early Access yet. The premise is interesting, the combat is great fun, it gives a real feeling of freedom. It is stoic, bad♥♥♥♥♥ hilarious; anything you want it to be. The game's only story is the story of your character, and what a tale it can be. Long and arduous; full of victories and defeats. The game is not near completion, so if you are looking for a fleshed out experience right now, I might advise against picking it up now but my heart goes out to the developers. This is the type of game many people have been waiting years for. If all goes well it will be a milestone in indie gaming; a truly unique experience.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								I bought this game shortly after it was released. Please for the love of your sanity do not buy this game, at least not yet. Ignore these positive reviews. Anyone that posts a positive review starting with some lame story is doing nothing but building the hype at thats all it is. You'll spend weeks just trying to get leveled up to be able to fight something and even then you'll still get pummeled. Right out of the gate you can't do jack♥♥♥♥♥♥to anything. All you can do is run through the desert and build your strength or running speed so you can lure enemys to the gates of a town so you can steal their armor and weapons. You can sell it or wear it but it still won't make a difference. You'll have to do this a hundred times before you can afford to even start building anything. Even after all of this you'll still not be able to kill anything, even with a group of hired hands. Moving around is ridiculous. I haven't seen such an awkward movement system since the alpha for ultima online and even they had something better than this. You'll right click to move and nothing will happen and you'll do this several times and still not go where you want your character to go. No W A S D controls whatsoever. The GUI is horrible, the character models and textures are disgusting. I've been back and forth with this game over the years hoping for some improvements but they've done very little. I cannot fathom how such little progress can be made in 3 years. If I look back at what it was then and what it is now I cannot see a bit of difference.

number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game reminds me of a skit I once saw from a television show on IFC. I believe the show is called Portlandia, and the sketch was Bicycle Movers. A lady calls movers to get her moved into her new house, so that she can sell the old one, and two people show up on a tandem bicycle pulling a toy red wagon. The lady grows increasingly frustrated as she continues to pay both mortgages, her items get broken, and they even move her things to the wrong house. All the while,they keep giving the excuse that they are bicycle movers and trying to sell her on the concept that they are somehow  the best choice. The are hip, independant, and cutting edge alternative.This game does precisely the same thing. It sells you on the idea that it is "Hip, Indie, and Cutting edge" It says its a squad based RPG, and in early access. When it arrives, you realize it isn't even playable, and things continue to get worse. All the while, nothing ever changes and when you ask why it is still in alpha after two years, people keep telling you how this is a, "One man dev crew..." and "it will be everything you ever dreamed once its finished". The problem is that both the experimental and main versions are essentially unplayable most of the time, and even when they are, there is nothing to do but wander around aimlessly getting in fights. Fights which by the way, you have little to no control over. The excuse of this being a one man Dev team is absurd. If that is the reason for this being in perpetual alpha, why isn't there a warning about that in big bold letters above the game page? No such warning existed when I purchased it! I don't care how great a craftsman someone is, I don't want one person building me a house by himself. Life is too short for such nonsense. Besides, from what I have seen, this game doesn't come anywhere near delivering what it promised it would. I hate to break it to the developer, but he is not a great craftsman, and this game is begining to border on being a scam. If this were something that no one but a great visionary could achieve, I could at least understand going it alone, but it doesn't look like the vision is much more than an occoasional passing interest on the part of the developer. I for one think refunds need to be issued to all who purchased the game. At this rate, the developer, and the rest of us, will be dead from old age before the game is completed.  Or better yet, try to sell the idea to a company who can get it finished. Either way, it is clear this game is taking to long to develop. By the time it gets anywhere, technology will have changed so much that it will look siilly and cartoonish. Of course it already looks silly and cartoonish.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								Admittedly I only played about an hour of the game, but hear me out.Kenshi's early game is extremely painful. I understand the game is supposed to be bleak and hopeless, and it's post apocalyptic, but the early game is boring and long. Every guide I've found to this game revolves around one theme: "DON'T GO FIGHT THINGS. LITERALLY ANY ENEMY IN THE GAME CAN KILL YOU 1v1." I gave it a shot though, and died horribly. Then I played the way the game told me to: Wait for a patrol, tag along, find lewt, sell lewt, buy better gear. It was half an hour for the patrol to finish on the fastest speed, and I had a slightly (.1 better damage) better sword, and half of the requisite money needed to hire a new guard. Enemies are hard to find, the map is difficult to navigate, and the early game is uneventful. Eventually I'll give this game more time, but honestly it doesn't catch me as early as a game should. I'm not super motivated to find more content. I hear the game is "Deep", and that the crafting is rich, and you can build your own town. Just how much of the boring roaming through featureless monotonous landscape hoping to find corpses do I have to endure before I get to the fun stuff? If you want a squad based game, I hear good things about Banner Saga. If you want strategy, look at Starcraft II, or Novus Aeterno on the horizon. So near as I can tell, this game isn't worth the twenty dollars.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								Still waiting for a game in this somewhere. It's not a bad program, as it stands - looks kinda cool, the dudes can do interesting things in a potentially interesting setting. Just, beneath the desert garb there's a skinny undernourished engine.The sum of all there is to do, aside from (alpha level, and expected) crash, glitch, bug and loading, is run around a bland, have my group perform a ninja dance and run on to the next dance performance with limps and loot, hopefully with the shoddy path-finding not dropping someone from the running.Trade? Minimal, and tiny profits, with a static supply/demand - this town will always be a place to stock up on armour plates cheaply, and offload steel bars at a profit .City building? Dull slog, with little to do aside from wait for more resources to be mined. Exploration? Empty desert, becomes empty swamp, becomes empty grasslands.IMO, combat the area that Kenshi is pretty good at making visually appealing (even if combat is largely moving towards the enemy, and letting a hands off free-for-all happen) is a means to an end - to produce opportunities and increase what I can do in the game. Being able to take on tougher groups of bandits just makes the ninja dance more difficult, not more interesting. A tough group can take on a town, and receive little opportunity or satisfaction.There's a lot of promise in the game, there's a lot of interesting things that need some work to become engaging. But there's not a game worth playing. Yet. So, I see why people are burnt/have been burnt out by Early Access, because even when the game is finished in however long, I've played the demo and rarely enjoyed it.Refund? No way. Well worth the price of it on sale, or for someone absolutely okay with a gamble on it clicking with them, despite the flaws mentioned. But with the reason of  'supporting the developer' or expecting to play an enjoyable, engaging game? Best find something else.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								Save your money. There is absolutely no gameplay in this game. Combat is right clicking, sitting back and watching, there is no challenge or skill, just grind.It's advertised like a samurai mount&blade with base building. What it really is, is a barrel landscape with nothing to do.99% of the map is a barren mountainous desert with no features besides towns you can visit. You start out with a weak guy, and then you decide what to do from there. Maybe appropriate for people that play D&D or minecraft, happy to pay money for a blank slate for you to paint your own picture. But if you've paid to be entertained, you would get more value out of a chocolate bar.I promised myself never to buy into alpha games, after getting ripped off buying towns, now I remember why. This game is the next abandonware project I've mistakenly paid into thanks to an impulse frontpage 40% off sale.

number of helpful: 6 of 16 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ugly as sin. Buggy with many crashes. The control system is not intuitive. It seems like you spend 97% of the game clicking the right mouse button. You need to search the internet for help with figuring out the most basic things. It feels like the game's developers had never actually played a computer game made since the year 2000 or seen a modern user interface.I suspect that if you are willing to fight your way through it is probably an interesting building / squad game. Frankly I just don't have the time to go back to the old days of gaming where figuring out how to play the game was half the battle. If you want to play this game be prepared to put in 100 hours.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Had this before it came to Steam - was buggy then, and buggy now.  There is a lot to like about this title, especially some of the ideas being implemented, but after several years of dev time, seeing how difficult it is just to do basic things, it simply isn't reassuring:Just entering buildings can be hit or miss - the interiors won't load sometimes and once that happens, you'll have to reload the save/game just to get it to function right again.Mining - well, this may not be a simulation, but in real life a person can swing a pickaxe about three times in the amount of time it takes for one swing in this game.Crafting - why have crafting when you can't gather basic resources - I can mine iron right from the get-go, but can't gather any other resources...?!?The map - why advertise a huge map only to find that most of it isn't accessible - not sure if it is unlocked in the experimental branch, but the game is already experimental to begin with (EA).Optimization - not just loading lag, but pretty much every other type of lag there is too.I'll put it on the back burner once again, pull it out in another year or so, and see what the progress is.  I'd like to see some real progress on it and hope people support it, but I can't actually recommend it right now.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought the game not that long ago and I'm getting fatal crashes every 10 minutes or so and I've tried all of the tips that everyone has said in all of the forums. It is a huge pain, but it's the only thing stopping me from telling everyone I know about how awesome Kenshi is. On that note, the game is still in alpha and I understand that I should expect some glitches or bugs, but for the money I spent on the game, I would expect at least some more support on solving this issue as the content of the game is quite sound and there's more than enough to keep up tied over until the developers fix the fatal crashes.At it's current stage (APLHA) this is my review;Audio: 7/10 - Ambient sounds are good, with the wind speed increasing when you increase game speed.Visual: 6/10 - For what the game is and how well it ran on my machine, the graphic content was sound. There are a few bugs and randomly whilst running your path may take you through a rock throwing you up into the sky.Content 8/10 - The content is great, there is enough in the game to have me spend hundreds of hours playing it. The dev's are focusing a lot of their time on new conent however this is a problem as per my gameplay review.Gameplay 3/10 - The problem exists with the majority of players that the game crashes between 2 minutes of game play through to 1 hour before it's inevitable fatal crash. This is the only problem that I have found with the game, as there are new concepts of AI and strategy bringing a very fresh new idea into the market.Replayability: 8/10 - Even with the game crashing every 10 minutes and without saving your progress you may have just wasted a lot of time, I have found myself putting more and more time into the game only to be pleased with the accomplishments (and a little let down by the crashes).So we have this amazing game right here, with fantastic content and new ideas but the major fatal crashes every few minutes is a huge problem. The game is in alpha, and if you are to purchase the game, keep that in mind. The dev's need to focus more on fixing the issues that are stopping the people from playing their game before moving onto making new content, at this stage, it's like the worlds best coffee being poured into a broken mug. You're unable to enjoy the coffee because the mug needs to be repaired.Final verdict: Kenshi is an amazing game with some brilliant ideas. I can see this game being played by all different types of gamers and possibly bringing in people don't generally play games. The only problem with buying it now, is that it crashes constantly and reducing your quality of game time. At this stage, I'm not going to recommend buying it for the simple fact that it is marginally unplayable. Once this is corrected or the final version is released, you'd be stupid not to buy it, just hold off for now :)

content:
Posted: August 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is proof that early access needs regulation. In the several years since I paid for this game, updates have change very little beyond textures, crafting mechanics, or bugfixing . I won't claim to know what the devs intentions are, or what the hell has them too busy, but the point is that Steam shouldn't allow projects like this to be sold on their market. It's a dying and wheezing animal, and theyre never going to finish it. The two things you see most people bring up are that it's in alpha ( as if that were an excuse), or that it has some great potential. Both of these statements mask what people are really feeling. Buyer's RemorseIf I ever meet Gabe Newell, I will motorboat him until he shuts this project down.

content:

Early Access Review
								I do not recommend anyone buy this game as it is now. I will say the concept of the game is great but I see little action going in manifesting these concepts into a great game. UPDATESIts been half a year now since there was an actual update. April 14th was the last true update there was one or two more that are in the experimental version only, but the game has so many bugs in the "stable version" that I would be hard pressed to attempt to play it any other way. I dont believe another update will ever come, but when they do they are normally small and feel much more like a fix patch than an actual update. My belief is that this game is going to go down the road of many starter games and the developer will stop altogether and move on. You may feel you got your money worth, but personally I expect more from a developer. I will say just recently the developer talked of some plans, but being that I have seen nothing since April come from these plans makes it nothing more than talk. In summary, if you like the concept and think it will eventually pan out then pull the trigger. However before you do, ensure your ready to wait a very long time before its completed.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've really enjoyed playing this game, I like the concept and style it has. I've had a lot of fun building up a squad, taking on some bandits, carrying half my unconsious squad back to safety and building a small town. The problem is that the game has very little polish, you will run into bugs (including crashes) and incomplete features often. Its clear that the development process is more like rolling a snowball than working through a feature list.I'm sure the final version of this game would be great, and have a lot of replay value. I doubt that I'll ever play it, because I don't think this game will ever be finished. I love supporting start-up games, but in my opinion this game is abusing the trust of it's supporters.I would not recommend this game because of the very infrequent updates, long development time and no timeline for a final release even after years of development. Its a great idea for a game, but how could I recommend it when it's been in this state for so long with no indication it will ever be finished?

content:
Posted: March 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I tried. But.. Unresponsive followers, lifeless boring towns, unintelligable stat systems, and shattered hope is all that you'll find here. 1. I would say diversify your map, but at this point it'd be better to just slice it in half and add the extra land mass later on. 2. Overhaul every aspect of combat, save animations. Combat is fun to watch, but 9 times out of 10 you will lose. Also, if your last person conks over, just give us that new game option immediately.3. Remove the gunky character creation system; it is a novel idea, but you are rarely zoomed in enough to care what your zerglings look like. 4. Make the x2 building and resource gathering settings the default. Waiting simulators are fun and all, but no.You either wait for a long time, and hope you can get something started, or you travel around like an ambulance chaser, shamefully following overpowered protectors as they aimlessly search the empty desert. I'll keep trying, but this game looks exactly the same as the day I bought it. Did they post anything about giving up on this game, or something?

content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'll just start off by stating my personal truth: I LIKE THIS GAME! I REALLY DO! But as for why I'm putting this as a Negative Post, read below.This game is something else! I mean that in a good way. I'm sure finally reaching my post anything I say you'll have already read, but the truth is the truth no matter how many times you hear it.My experience has shown me that this game is really not that bad, in fact I'll admit that its down right addicting (check the play time on some of the posts and alot of them are well into the triple digits ((mine's no different)) ). But I gotta be honest the number of minor glitches (which I gotta admit are relatively small in terms of quantity in my opinion) that are biting at this game are the biggest pain of all. I realise that the game is early release and all but I honestly think if the development team focused their COLLECTIVE attention on ironing out ONE OR TWO BUG(S) AT A TIME and improved the stability of the game rather then trying to broaden the gameplay by adding new 'creatures' or 'bigger, better walls' then Kenshi would become one of those games you'll start playing after breakfast (or during in my case) and then when you get up to go to the bathroom (because you've literally reached you're limit) you realise you've been playing for almost 18 hours straight. I can admit that my statement above may not actually be productive, but when you've reached the point that you've spent more time trying to actually BUILD the perimeter of your outpost rather than enjoying the other characteristics of Kenshi, you find you're self thinking about not playing the game for a few weeks in the hopes that these particular kinks get taken care of when you come back.I won't tell you not to buy the game, but I will warn you, if you buy this game you're in for a few headaches and more than a few bouts of frustration. I, like many of the other posts, will advise you to WAIT on purchasing Kenshi for the time being.At least until there are a few less posts (both positive and negative ones) that are warning you about the bugs and stability issues. If you still decide to buy Kenshi, I can only hope the developer's have ironed out a few more kinks then there are now while i'm writing this post.

number of helpful: 4 of 13 people (31%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game has quite a learning curve to get used to, and is currently single player only (for those curious). Basically when you first start out you can't kill anything, anything at all because your character is so weak. You can also recruit an infinite number of people into your facton or party which is basically how you start your own town and build your own army.The reason why I do not recommend this game, is that the controls feel quite clunky to me, and that this game is extremely time consuming. You need to devote A LOT of time and, most importantly, patience when playing this. I have devoted a lot of time to many other games, but Kenshi does not feel quite as enjoyable to me, and I dont get that feeling of satisfaction from accomplishing something because quite frankly, I neither have the patience nor the willingness to put in hours of work into this game.Notice how I haven't really put that much time into playing Kenshi. But by reading guides, looking at other reviews, and looking at the game mechanics myself, it was pretty easy to conclude that yes, this game is extremely time consuming.The game also seems to be a bit buggy, a lot of the time doors will not open or close, your character and/or party members clip through walls, and bandits (or people who just want to kill you) will literally follow you FOREVER until they are killed. And good luck killing ANYTHING at all. The only way to kill even a couple of wandering banidts is to find a friendly faction or run to a town and let the guards kill the bandits for you. But be careful, because if the town's faction is friendly to the group trying to kill you, the town guards will simply ignore them and watch as they slaughter you and your party.From reading other reviews from players that have put in much more time than i have (30+ hours), the game hasn't changed all that much. When Steam early access first started, I remember Kenshi as being one of the first games to join Early Access. Since then, very little updates have been made. Check out their changelog, it's a jumbled mess of adding insignificant content (more cities, more armor, etc) when there are other bugs/balance changes that should be addressed.This is simply my take on this game that i honestly haven't invested that much time into nor plan to. You certainly have the right to agree or disagree with my statements, or justify any crude remarks with "Oh, you just haven't played the game enough", or "You're basing your reviews off of other's gameplay expirience rather than your own". I just can't recommend this game to anyone.
