content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								I downloaded Kenshi because it boasts an open world, a free roaming "squad based" game. Well, it is, BUT..What his game COULD be is amazing, sadly, the controls and camera ruined it. I spent my whole time moving around by right clicking too far off in the distance, losing my character, panning over a field to find him, only to find that I lost my dog.Well, you could double click their icons, but that separates you and if you double click your main hero, you're now separated from the group and it just feels clunky to find your way back.I didn't like how the camera was stuck, how you you are fixed at a certain crappy angle, and as you pan through the scale to find your team, you just fly through buildings and hills, and overall, it feels crowded and in my opinion, the camera/controls made it unbearable.I requested a refund, I felt it was THAT bad, and I'm typically a pretty forgiving person.I want to recommend this game, as everything else about it seems absolutely wonderful, but until they change the camera/control combination, I can't.

content:
Posted: January 30
Early Access Review
								So I start the game up, the character creation is cool and adds a lot of customization I spend some time making my character and finally have her they way I like. I spawn next to a house with two fields and two farmers and no tutorial or anything. I think to myself it's nice that they'll let me learn on my own and go in the house to look around, all I find is stuff I have the option to steal. I figure the farmers aren't really my friends because I have to steal to take stuff from the house. I went outside of the house and tried to cut down some trees, can't, go walking away a bit and find a bush which I want to interact with, can't, walk away a little farther away and find different trees to try and cut down, can't. I think to myself maybe I have to craft an axe but the crafting menu is empty... ok so I have to build something first maybe? I try to build a small shack but it requires 3 "Building Material". I go to look for something I can interact with to get building material, after wandering for like 5 minutes I find a rock I can mine, the magical pickaxe I can pull out of my♥♥♥♥♥appears and I mine the rock wondering the whole time why I can't cut a tree. I have some iron at this point and I figure "This must be a building material." I then try to build a shack again, can't. I realized that there is a tech research at this point for "Building material" but it requires I have a research bench which requires "Building Material" and must be placed in a small shack! I give up and look up a guide, you have to trade for "Building Material" this is the only way early game and I tried a few times to earn the money by mining rocks but they made me too heavy and bandits or animals would kill me everytime. The only way to really start the game is to aggro a bandit group and drag them into a town so gaurds fight them.This game lacks any direction, has no real goals, is beyond confusing to start, and extremely slow. I would highly advise NOT to buy this game.

number of helpful: 4 of 14 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Kenshi would be a fun game if there were actually guides or something to help you find a direction to get started. Unfortunately the only way people suggest you start out is by luring bandits to towns, and looting whatever the guards kill, even the devs themselves suggest doing this. The problem with this is that it is not creative and not immersive. When guards kill something and you loot it and that's literally the ONLY way to make money from the start, it really is unrewarding and limiting. That alone should tell you that there are very few aveneus to take when it comes to starting out and making money. There are no jobs, no other skills you can use to make money like crafting, or anything like that. No, you can only do one thing at the start, that's it, and it's not even realistic or rewarding. I have had this game for years and have come back to it a handful of times to see if it has gotten any better, unfortunately it has not gotten better.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								The War of 1812 was a military conflict that lasted from June 18, 1812 to February 18, 1815, fought by the United States of America against Great Britain, its North American colonies, and its North American Indian allies. Historians in the United States and Canada see it as a war in its own right, but Europeans sometimes see it as a minor theatre of the Napoleonic Wars, as it was caused by issues related to that war (especially the Continental System). By the war's end in early 1815 the key issues had been resolved and peace came with no boundary changes.The United States declared war for several reasons, including trade restrictions brought about by the British war with France, the impressment of as many as 10,000 American merchant sailors into the Royal Navy,[5] British support for Native American tribes fighting American settlers on the frontier, outrage over insults to national honor during the Chesapeake–Leopard Affair, and possible American interest in annexing British territory.[6] The primary British war goal was to defend their North American colonies, although they also hoped to set up a neutral Indian buffer state in the Midwest.The war was fought in three theatres. First, at sea, warships and privateers of each side attacked the other's merchant ships, while the British blockaded the Atlantic coast of the United States and mounted large raids in the later stages of the war. Second, land and naval battles were fought on the U.S.–Canadian frontier. Third, large-scale battles were fought in the Southern United States and Gulf Coast. At the end of the war, both sides signed and ratified the Treaty of Ghent and, in accordance with the treaty, returned occupied land, prisoners of war and captured ships (though neither side returned the other's warships due to frequent re-commissioning upon capture) to its pre-war owner and resumed friendly trade relations without restriction.With the majority of its land and naval forces tied down in Europe fighting the Napoleonic Wars, the British used a predominantly defensive strategy in the Provinces of Upper and Lower Canada. Early victories over poorly-led U.S. armies, such as in the Battle of Queenston Heights, demonstrated that the conquest of the Canadas would prove more difficult than anticipated. Despite this, the U.S. was able to inflict serious defeats on Britain's Native American allies, ending the prospect of an Indian confederacy and an independent Native American state in the Midwest under British sponsorship. U.S. forces were also able to make several gains and score victories on the Canadian frontier; taking control of Lake Erie in 1813, seizing western parts of Upper Canada. However, a large-scale U.S. attempt to capture Montreal was repulsed in November 1813. Despite the major U.S. victory at Chippawa on July 5, 1814, serious U.S. attempts to fully conquer Upper Canada were ultimately abandoned following the bloody Battle of Lundy's Lane on July 25, 1814. The U.S. then fell back roughly 30 km (19 mi) from Lundy's Lane to Fort Erie, where they withstood a siege for several months. The British eventually withdrew, but as winter set in, the Americans demolished the fort and fell back across the Niagara.In April 1814, with the defeat of Napoleon, the British adopted a more aggressive strategy, sending larger invasion armies and tightening their naval blockade. However, with the end of the Napoleonic Wars in Europe, both governments were eager for a return to normality and peace negotiations began in Ghent in August 1814. In the Deep South, General Andrew Jackson destroyed the military strength of the Muscogee (Creek) Nation at the Battle of Horseshoe Bend. In September 1814, the British won the Battle of Hampden, allowing them to occupy eastern Maine, and the British victory at the Battle of Bladensburg in August 1814 allowed them to capture and burn Washington, D.C. They were repulsed, however, in an attempt to take Baltimore and Fort Bowyer, and during their assault at Fayal. An American victory in September 1814 at the Battle of Plattsburgh repulsed the British invasions of New York, which, along with pressure from merchants on the British government, prompted British diplomats to drop their demands at Ghent for an independent native buffer state and territorial claims that London previously sought. Given that it took six weeks for ships to cross the Atlantic, news of the peace treaty did not arrive before the British suffered a major defeat at New Orleans in January 1815.[7]In the United States, late victories over invading British armies at the battles of Plattsburg, Baltimore (inspiring the United States national anthem, "The Star-Spangled Banner") and New Orleans produced a sense of euphoria over a "second war of independence" against Britain.[8][9] The war ended on a high note for Americans, winning the final engagements of the war and bringing an "Era of Good Feelings" in which partisan animosity nearly vanished in the face of strengthened American nationalism. The war was also a major turning point in the development of the U.S. military. The poor performance of several U.S. militia units, particularly during the 1812–13 invasions of Canada and the 1814 defence of Washington, convinced the U.S. government of the need to move away from its Revolutionary-era reliance on militia and focus on creating a more professional regular force. Spain was involved in fighting in Florida but was not an official belligerent; some Spanish forces fought alongside the British during the Occupation of Pensacola. The U.S. took permanent ownership of Spain's Mobile District.In Upper and Lower Canada, British and local Canadian militia victories over invading U.S. armies became iconic and promoted the development of a distinct Canadian identity, which included strong loyalty to Britain. Today, particularly in Ontario, memory of the war retains its significance, because the defeat of the invasions ensured that the Canadas would remain part of the British Empire, rather than be annexed by the United States. In Canada, numerous ceremonies took place in 2012 to commemorate the war, offer historical lessons and celebrate 200 years of peace across the border.[10] The conflict has not been commemorated on nearly the same level in the modern-day United States, though it is still taught as an important part of early American history,[11] and Dolley Madison's and Andrew Jackson's respective roles in the war are especially emphasized.[12][13] The war is scarcely remembered in Britain, being heavily overshadowed by the much larger Napoleonic Wars occurring in Europe.

content:
Posted: March 25
Early Access Review
								Update: 08/04/2017Wait until the release!The game gets pached on regular basis. The patches may not campatible with save game. There is option to import your save, but it is bugged (at least for me), where I lost my progress (e.g research even tho I ticked transfer research box)).Old review:-------------------------Kenshi is a brilliant idea with poor execution.The main reason I am leaving negative review is the game performance and bugs. I will get back to this later.Kenshi is an open world, RPG, city builder, squad manager, craft and survival with great mod support. I wish there were more games of this genre (RPG city builder, minus the survival). It would bring some higher standards and higher quality of the games of that genre.The first things first. Loading time is veeeery loooong (bad).The game has a number of different scenario starts (good). Character customisation is acceptable, there are a few classes available (ok).The first few moments in game were tedious, I was grinding my time just to eat and survive, even tho I used the lowest hunger settings. Then I discovered mods. So, I used no hunger mod, which would eventually introduce a bug when you find a hungry NPC that you want to recruit into your squad. After the hunger was sorted, I started grinding stuff for money and research accompanied by poor performance. I recruited a few squad members and started grinding stuff for more research and I eventually started building my outpost (city). Unfortunately, my attempt to grow or produce anything would be ruined by either hungry beasts or bandits. OK, I managed beasts and bandits well, but then a faction that was non hostile to me attacked me. All this was accompanied by a poor performance.If your outpost or squad members get attacked, there is no pause / notification and if you are in fast forward time mode, you are screwed. But hey, you can always reload your last save... that would take forever to load.Uh...Aesthetically, the game is not that appealing. The game world reminds me of Morrowind (that was the Year of 2002).Please do not get me wrong, there are so many things to do in the game that are fun (exploring, looting, fighting), but they are accompanied by poor performance and bugs.I really feel bad for discrediting the developers, because they put a lot of effort into this game. Maybe if they fix performance, I will be back.Did I mention poor performance and bugs?Maybe the fact that the game has been developed since 2009?Specsi7-4710HQ16 GB RAMGTX-980M

I was banned for evaluating the game I'm talking about here (it was banned many other critics)DONT TRUST TO DEVELOPERS:dont believe for progression update:All updates which they are adding to the game are only cosmetic changes. Important bugs which make the game unplayable (path finding, stuck NPC, disordered structures (stuck npc During production) and still doesnt removed and doesnt fixed, these bugs were in alpha which started few years ago and still exist in the game. = ZERO PROGRESSION, JUST COSMETIC CHANGES AND STRONG WORDS BY DEVELOPER ABOUT FUTURE PROGRESS... Do not believe what the graphic looks on pictures and arts:I have GTX 970 and the graphic is really bad and ugly!! Nothing change. But go on oficial website you will se perfect graphic, but its lie!Dont believe to promises:They many times said: game crash fixed(UNTRUTH), memory leaks fixed(UNTRUTH), performance improvments(UNTRUTH), UPDATES COMING(UNTRUTH = NEW BUGS COMING).THE GAME IS AT THE SAME STAGE AS FOUR YEARS AGO << TOTALY EPIC TRUTH! NOTHING CHANGES just adding useless updates which never fixed bugs > THIS GAME IS UNPLAYABLE. QUOTATIONS FROM OTHERS OBJECTIVE REVIEWS: " I have only had it for the last year or so, and must say little work has been done in that time. Sure, a patch comes up every month or two, but only to add a new useless model, or a non working one. Something trivial that really adds too little to this beautiful broken sandbox. "                                                                                                                  "booyoov""He patches it, breaks it, makes it unplayable, u wait for 6 months to a year for him to add content. number of helpful: 4 of 16 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Bort this game 2 years ago and I enjoyed it more then. It had bugs but it was enjoyable to play. I was able to survice long enough to start and maintain a health community that could survive a bandit attack. So after not playing for 2 years, I thought that would be enough time for the game to be finished. However in all that time the new features added are so broken that the game is unplayable (if fun is the goal). Lately gameplay is start new game, first town guard that sees me attacks me. Why? See a fight go to it to see if you can loot some dead body. What now it is stealing to loot a corpse it you didn't attack. In the early game looting corpses is the may occupation, however just standing near a fight will cause the guards to attack you. Why? my weapon is not drawn. This is all in the first town in the first 10 mins. Talk to someone town guard attacks you. Be a multi racial group town guards attack you. If you manage to get past the town guard and find a bandit, hopefully you don't starve to death first. Now bandit are rare thing to find. 2 years ago there was a bandit attack every 10 mins. Kill the bandit loot his corpse. Finally I have something to cover my naked chest. Go to town to sell loot. Town guard see me and kills me. I guess because I was wearing the bandits clothing I was a bandit. Makes no sense in any RPG game out there.There seem to be a complicated system for factions that is broken. As I said 2 years ago I thought that if they fixed the bugs and finished the crafting trees. All the game needed was some direction. There are no quest marker or any aid as where to go. There is not even a quest system. So if you get a quest go to the temple, that is it. No more info as to where this temple is. Needless to say I never found the temple. Even after running into every building in the town. A simple marker on the map and a icon above the build. How difficult would that be compared to trying to fix broken systems like slavery, factions etc. At this point that would be to much to ask for. I would be happy if I could play the game without getting attacked by the town guard for no apparent reason and at least know why in the starting town am I attacked on sight.This game had massive potential but I don't think the devs have the skills needed to manifest that potential. In 2 years the game is more broken than what it was. That is why I give this a thumbs down.

								The next is from my first around 5-10 minutes of attempting to play this game. Spoiler alert - after such initial reactions I doubt I'll play this before it stops being Earyl Access and since it was in development for like 2+ years and still... well... these. I doubt it'll ever will. I'm sorry developers, but if you make game about Japan or something with honor - you kinda has to have something similar yourself.1. My name (Alexander) doesn't fit into damn name box under character portrait2. His head doesn't fit into hairs and goes through them3. It just... crashed when I first go to character creation4. Hint for hold middle mouse to rotate camera doesn't work5. When it first starts - that area in launcer which looks like big text box... I thought it's text box. Apparently it's options. U click on a line and can change option. Very intuitive.6. By default it's not full screen and u can't scroll to full screen options in settings7. In windowed default mode main menu buttons just... drops somewhere to the right...8. There are no < or > texts on buttons on character selection...9. 								Please remember this is early access.Right now the game is poor at best. The optimization is really bad. I have a high end machine and the frame rate is just terrible even with the settings turned down.Gameplay is in my opinion the worst part of the game. Starting out, your weak, poor, and frankly, you cant do anything about it. If you read disscussions on starting tips, youll find everyone says to hang around cities and let guards kill bad guys and then loot the dead. This is great advice as you are completely unable to do any fighting yourself and survive. So the game from the begenning is based on you playing a weakling coward who scavenges the leavings of other fighters. This just doesnt sit good with me. I would rather grind or do fetch quests to raise skill enough to do my own fighting. I find it insulting that a developer would make the game this way. No reccomendation untill they actually make a game instead of a buzzard simulator.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is probably the single worst entertainment purchase I have ever made and I saw Crossroads - the Britney Spears movie in theaters. I bought it during the early access craze based on it's potential 2 years ago. I bought Kerbal Space Program around the same time. KSP had its issues, but clearly had changes being made and steadily got better and has reached full release. Every so often I popped in this game and tried to play thinking it would be better in any way and it simply wasn't. I saw reviews stating essentially that you have to get 3-5 hours in before my complaints with the game are no longer valid (boring world, looks like garbage, clunky interface, shattered hopes and dreams) and while that may be true, it seems like Stockholm Syndrome to me. The fact that this game has been in "Alpha" since 2009 is just more proof that it shouldn't even be for sale.Do yourself a favor and don't buy this game until it gets a full release. Don't be fooled by people who put in a ton of time and tell you it is great as long as you get over X, Y, and Z- it is just justification for wasting their own time and money. This is an incomplete, likely never to be complete, dumpster fire of a game. Value yourself and your time more - don't buy this game. I expect that this "game" will be a fully playable and complete game for its value around the time of the heat death of the universe.

content:
Posted: January 19
Early Access Review
								I regret buying this game. This really burned me. I thought the concept was really amazing, I thought the graphics were decent for what we were looking at in terms of supposed game play. Let me tell you now why I would never recommend this game or ever suggest buying it.1. It is unplayable. Truly it is. It is so bad, incredibly glitchy, and it is insanely hard. There is no objective so you are left to wander about with nothing to do, you literally just try to survive. Which is damn near impossible. EVERY faction will hate you, and you cannot join a faction to gain allies.2. The build system is a joke. Like honestly I have nothing good to say about it. You will not survive long enough to dig far enough into. Once you reach a certain point a wandering group of 30ish bandits will just wander around your camp and kill everything. 3. There is no gameplay. There is no point like I said before, but needs to be said again. Like its just survive, which is cool in all, and it WOULD be fulfilling if it were not for the fact there is ZERO NPC or story interaction.In a nutshell I would desribe this game in the following way: basically it is a kid playing in a sand box, byhimself, with zero imagnination. You are alone, by yourself with nothing to do, you got two plastic army men and thats it. Oh and it is raining and squirlles are terrorizing you.

								The description of the game excited me. I found the execution of the game (at time of writing) did not meet with the excitement and expectation. The controls are very awkward. His pickaxe was actually digging into turf. After several minutes of mining the turf, there was nothing in my inventory.My character had a hunger attribute. None of my activities seemed reduce it (this may be an unfinished feature). My starting point was near some domestic beasts, but my character was not able to do anything with them.After running around the game world for about 20 minutes, trying different things, and getting lost, I refunded the game. That was a disappointment to me. Maybe as the game progresses in development I'll pick it up again.

content:

Early Access Review
								The game is still in alpha, but the amount of content being added is great. It recieves regular updates, and more than just simple bug fixes. Most updates include new features such as the recent addition to harpoon turrets to defend your base. Current version is 0.69.0. The game has music and sound now. Many improvements have been made to the stability of the game.My original statement of the game was that it had more than enough content to keep you busy for hours upon end. This is still true, even more so now. The combat system is great, for a squad based RTS. I really love the health and damage system. Still needs a little work, and he still needs to make the troops hold their weapons with a closed hand, but it works for now :pHaving an individual health bar for multiple body parts is interesting and brilliant. If the health for your guys arm goes too low, his arm becomes useless and just flops around. For the legs, he begins to limp heavily. Its fun to have a great big fight, then see the casualties stumbling onwards showing signs of their beating.Most importantly, this game does not hold your hand or treat you like a child. You will lose fights. You will be horribly beaten to a pulp. But you will get up, and fight harder. No magical being is going to swoop down and save you when you are moments from death. Only your allies or your own training can save your life.This game is now going for $19.99 ($17.99 if you get it during the current summer sale) and is worth every penny. I have no regrets about buying into this early access, as this developer actually earns our hard earned money by releasing high quality content. Try it out.

Early Access Review
								This game... Has the potentiel to be one of the best games of all time.  It is a lot of fun and hours will fly faster dollar bills at a strip club.  You will love Kenshi, but I wouldn't recommend getting in now in its current state.The only reason I say this is because it will torture you for waiting.You will play the game, and you will learn everything and thrive.  After awhile you'll realize that its all pointless.  It's all pointless because you will cap out early and everything willl go away whenever the next update comes out.  Because it's still in eary access.My problem is that you could create the greatest character, but it's pointless because it'll all be gone whenever the next update comes out.  Every update adds great rich content to the game; although, the game updates slower than dial-up.The game has been in developement for about three or so years I believe, and it will probably be at least another year before its completion.  I'm still technically recommending the game because I can't bring myself to actually not recommend it.  It truly is an amazing game that everyone should get.  If you've read this article hopefully you take this advice: wait till it officially releases to buy it, or if its on sale buy it and wait till its actual release or later builds.  It will save you many hours and heartache.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was kind of worried I might have bought the game and wasted 20 bucks on it, turns out to be really amazing once you get into it. It has its ups and downs, for example: some buildings are buggy, sometimes pathing isn't the best, some characters will stay stuck in a rock. But, since it is alpha state, I guess you can give it a little of a blind eye, the updates aren't as frequent, don't expect one every week or so. The game starts out slow, and is a really slow pace game, however, once you understand everything you will get so into it. For example: you will won't go into a bandit fight and hope to win, with just three characters with you, unless you plan how to distract some, and move around to flank. Maybe you want to be a loner, well, you start at the bottom and make your way to the top. Slowly, but surely, you will make it. Want to build the best town in the whole map? Go ahead, but prepare yourself for some random battles with the bandits. Want to be a merchant? Then you must travel the whole land to might the best prices to buy and then sell. The best thing about the game, is simply put, this is how you make your story. You aren't unique, just a regular guy. Good luck.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								In response to a forum post I responderd:I bought it 3 days ago and have played 15 hrs so far. Quite addicting.It's sort of a tough grind but relaxing at the same time.I started on the Wonderer setting (single char with 1000 coin) and am slowly building up a little clan whilst trying to develop a base (shack / research bench / hemp farm / wheat farm / rum distillary / wind power etc) and adventuring out to towns to buy supplies. All the while one is under threat from marauding groups of bandits which can leave your folk injured / knocked out but can also provide a source of cash for selling their weapons etc (get the town guard to attack them by running girly like to town with a train of bandits in tow). The characters build up rpg type stats e.g. engineering for building, science for research and various athletic / sword skills for more vigorous pursuits.So there is plenty of game to be played now from the get-go. I look forward to many updates to follow.I recommend it muchly.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have about 150 hours into this game with no clear purpose as to what I am doing. Which means its freaking bas♥♥♥♥♥fun. I usually hate role playing but this game just makes it so easy. You can customize your own troops, outfit them however you want and name them or even give them ranks (in their name). I make camps make money capture slaves and battle them against my guys to level them up. I have always looked for a game ever since FFTactics where you could have your own generic troops that you can mold %100. The fighting is awesome too. It’s fun watching them swing and block. I whole heartedly recommend this game. Have some patience with it, start off slow, stay near towns and scavenge until you can make it on your own. It has been getting better and the developer is very active.

content:

Early Access Review
								Amazing open world RPG or RTS, depending on your playstyle. Huge ammount of depth so far, and easy to lose yourself in. Tons of bugs though that must be said, but there is an auto-save feature aswell as quick-save/quick-load to negate this (somewhat). Keep in mind, this is an early access game.Very unique art style to say the least. Imagine some sort of post-apocolyptic desert world filled with bandits and people trying to uphold some sort of law, and sprinkle this with some heavily inspired steampunk and oriental saumrai design. Interesting gaming mechanics all over the place with forging of clans, building of villages and starting a trading society.All in all, I strongly suggest you check it out. Atleast see some YouTube videos of it's gameplay. 9/10

								This is a really great game. it is unique and it offers something really great for RPG Lovers. You can have a whole group of worthless peasants and turn them into the ultimate fighting force to just go out and kick♥♥♥♥♥and on top of that you can build your own little outpost or even a whole village if you wantedThe game is still heavilly in development but seeing the game was created by just 1 guy its really impressive. At first the game took ages to see updates but from what i know the dev employed some skilled helpers to bring the game up to speed and updates are more frequent now.The main thing I love about this game is that you play it at your pace. If you just want to chill and build a base you can however you have to haul materials or create a mine and processor and fabricate your own materials or you can just go out and live off the land and loot all the dead bodies you leave in your wake. :) If you like rpgs and like games where you can build and research I would def say this game is a must buy. Just keep in mind it is an early access game and bugs are expected :)

content:
Posted: April 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								After much skepticism and debating whether or not I should purchase this game, I finally did (obviously). Good god, was it worth it! I've put nearly 10 hours into the game up to this point and I haven't even touched building yet. I've been obsessing with making each merc I hire as unique and 'real' as possible. Maybe a medic won't focus so much on their strength, so they won't have as big of muscles as their heavy armor-clad samurai companion would. You get the point. All in all, for what the game currently is, and claims to become, $20 is a meager price to pay. Remember, the game is still in early access, there will probably be bugs/glitches/crashes/etc (still worth it, in my opinion.). I give it a 7.5/10 at the moment ONLY because it is incomplete. I give the concept an absolute 11/10.

content:

Early Access Review
								If your looking for a unique RPG roaming game, this is your game. This has been my first game in development that I have played and Ive loved it alot. Just the ideas the developer has makes the game worth it. There are MANY bugs that are there, but the developer makes sure that he gets the opinions of the players and makes sure to fix everything. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Now, first things first, this game graphics look like crap and are unfinished. Now that's out of the way let me intoduce you to the most in depth and strangely fun gamnes I have ever played. Kenshi is a rpg in the same sort of realm as Mount and Blade Warband. It gives you complete freedom to do what you like, become a swordsman, a farmer, a merchant. Whatever you like. The first hours of the game will be confusing and slow but it really speeds up once you get yourself a base and some people to defend it. One of my favourite moments from the game has to be the moment when I sandwhiched between a war from the two major factions. With no where to go, I just made my character run around while a conga line of soldiers was forming to be the first to stick him in the ribs. Also, if you aren't convinced yet, Samurai swords... and sand ninjas.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Kenshi offers something that many current games seem to be unable to attain; a world that is detailed enough to get your interest and tap into your curiosity, but not to the point where you find yourself checking off a list of 'things to do'. The expanse of this world is so big that I found myself just traveling for the vistas rather than any goal such as attaining better gear or trading between towns.Naturally, there is a learning curve to begin with as you learn how to operate your character or squad as well as navigate the user interface, but this quickly becomes second nature despite its seemingly complex design.My favorite aspect of this game is the hands-off combat, I thoroughly enjoyed watching my little dudes sword fight bandits on their own, deciding when to attack and when to block. It is very reminiscent of the visceral melee combat system in games like Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War, minus the iconic 'execution' animations. To sweeten the deal, losing a fight is not necessarily the end. After a while of unconsciously baking in the desert sun, your guy will get back up, clutching his open wounds in a delirious state. From there, you can patch your character up with bandages and splints and then agonizingly limp yourself back to the closest village you can find to sleep it off. This is made significantly easier with the fast-forward feature.Upon healing yourself to maximum health you will find that your guy has gained toughness points in his statistics for being such a badass and surviving, making your next encounter more favorable to you. This creates a wonderful narrative of the 'underdog' rising up against his nemesis, be it an extorting bandit leader, a tribe of hungry cannibals with your friends captured or the terrifying sand Ninja who massacred your village. For a game with no storyline, you will find that the natural unfolding of events creates a tale worthy of writing down!As Kenshi is still in alpha, there are bugs and various glitches present. I have crashed once or twice when the NPC population was too high and the AI's pathing can be a little goofy sometimes, as can their work orders if you assign them roles in your village. Sometimes they will stand around in confusion as they try to figure out how to dump freshly smithed swords into a full weapon cabinet.These glitches are all easily remedied and hardly detract from the gameplay.I believe that this game is worth the cost, and given the promise of more features in the future it will only get better with age. If you have ever wanted to play a game that was a wonderful mixture of Western and Samurai genre in a RTS format, then I highly suggest Kenshi.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is a very flexible open-world game, with a game engine which consist of neatly balanced mechanisms such as damage/death system, economy system, base building group commanding systems as well. As for now there is no victory condition like a story ending- you need to choose what do you want to achieve yourself. You can be a fighter, trader, bandit or even a commander of a whole bunch of your folks equipped with whatever you gave them, each one with his own abilities and skills. Every man in your party can be trained in a different way starting from a slave/worker to a thief or even a turret operator. I like this game, because of the number of posibillities of what you could be from the start of the game to the ending.However, in my honest opinion, I think that the game still lacks a few things that could make the game 4267356345 times better than now. Things like: rideable horses (<3), archery (planned in future), long weapon group, such as spears or sth and a finishing move to kill the bad guys that fell on the ground wounded (yep, you cannot finish him, unless he is to much shredded that he will bleed to death).In sum of all I can give it a 9/10 grade, because of the missing content I already mentioned :)Cheers,Woodman

Remember, the game is still in early access, there will probably be bugs/glitches/crashes/etc (still worth it, in my opinion.). I give it a 7.5/10 at the moment ONLY because it is incomplete. I give the concept an absolute 11/10.

content:
Posted: January 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								tl;dr This game isn't for everyone but if you love open world sand box games you can easily mod yourself and play anyway you want you should get a kick out of this game.Kenshi is an open world sandbox for you to create your own goals and achieve them any way you want. It can be played as a solo character (lone samurai) type, or you can control a whole suad and build a town, researching and gathering your resources along the way, or you can even play as a trader by hiring your own in-town characters to manage your local business management (This is my favourite as it allows for powerful growth and you can learn the trading trends).Unfortunately there is not a ton of optimization going on here. The way I play, I have my squad dispersed across the whole (GIANT) map and I have to jump between them regularily, although there is no loading screen, it takes a couple seconds each time, and when you are doing things like just checking prices or looting multiple towns at once, it can be a little annoying.The $20 price may seem like a lot for the performance you have to deal with but by no means should that scare you away from this. There is only one guy making this game so the progress isn't terribly fast but he has been working hard on better game performance and addressing the needs and wants of the community.

								Okay when I first downloaded the kenshi it was something 0.40. Man it was ugly. BUT dont you dare to judge the cookie on its looks rather than taste. No Seriously. The game is in early access please keep it in mind when you're deciding to buy. It has lot of features starting as an retired capitan for example boosts your starting stats in fights but leaves your pockets empty and one faction seriously♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off that they want you dead. Very good solution for starters are to loot weapons from bandits when they attacking the town OR you lure them but be warned you're not superhero you're just an human with barely any special traits at all. If you want to outrun bandits first learn how to scram really fast or they'll catch up and probably kill you. But exacly that it is about a struggle to survive to build first outpost to gather resources and money for them. Though theres no quest lines yet theres still plenty to do max up technology gather as much resources as you can and better equipment whenever its possible buy blueprints that dont comes cheap and most important harden your main character as well your team mates. And for god sake think. Dont fight with 2 hostile parties that already is fighting with each other. Wait a bit till battle end and finish them off looting as much as you can. You dont want to get caught in battle versus 3 other hostile to you squads. Trust me

Aside from one regularly occuring crash, the only bugs I encounter are just plain hilarious and actually make the game more enjoyable. I only purchased this game not even a week ago and im already at 24 hours of playing I think. Considering the features which apparently are planned, this game will be one of those ones you just wont get sick of.

								Do I recommend this game. Yes. But I believe it needs a lot more work. The interface is clunky, the concept is awesome, but the GUI is confusing, and the melee is pretty relentless. I don't mean that in a good way. I couldn't really grasp it the way I thought it would be, especially for $20. Unfortunately I bought it right after a steam sale for this, and I didn't even realize it. :/ Hopefully you keep updating this game. I'd like to see where it goes, I've been following the development for a while, and finally got my hands on it. I was kinda let down, but I have hopes that you'll get it running smoothly eventually.

content:

Early Access Review
								A brilliant game, well worth the money paid for it. Even though it's only at alpha, it still has a ton of content, and the foundations for more stuff is sitting there waiting. I would NOT recommend this game if you're easily frustrated: the learning curve for this game is steep, and you will have to start fresh a few times: One of the few play throughs I wasn't imediately slaughtered in, I made the mistake of hiring worthless scum for my squad instead of dishing out for trained soldiers; kept having to abandon my base due to ninja raids. But with a little patience, some long-term planning and some luck, you can really build something awesome in this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								When I first started this game, literally the first thing I did, was die. After acidentally clicking to attack a guy I didnt know, whilst in a town, just seeing what the buttons do. I was beaten to death by that guy, plus a shop keeper and about ten or so guards. was a pretty funny start. Then I spent the next hours or so getting to know the menus, the stats, and finding out how much my guy sucked at combat, and so the next few hours was spent aggroing swarms of enemies into the towns, so I can steal their armour and sell it for moneys, for which I bought myslef a few new friends, and med kits.Now about 9 hours in, I have a strong group of 10 with mixed skills, a small town, if you can call it that, which I have a few homes, a shop, a stone mine and processor for profits, small shacks with I use for melee training or trapping people in, without armour, I had 15 in one small shack at one point, they kept fighting each other as they were different clans too. So I had to take their weapons away from them to stop them killing each other :)Now im a quite resource supplier to the towns nearby. I have eleven meaty guys and gals who are ready to kill at a whim, two are medics, two are pack mules and four are tanks. Two are workers for my stone mine and the new farm I created. Tghe last one is my scientist, does nothing but research in a locked room. So, if you like deep games, with a more than meets the eye amount of gameplay, then get this game. The above I have achieved without really knowing what to the game was about or how to play it. So you can do it with little, if any, guidance provided you are willing to explore the game yourself, which recommend you do. Stick with this game, get your squad stong and this game is awesome, for early access one of the best i'v enjoyed so far...

content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is a really great game. it is unique and it offers something really great for RPG Lovers. You can have a whole group of worthless peasants and turn them into the ultimate fighting force to just go out and kick♥♥♥♥♥and on top of that you can build your own little outpost or even a whole village if you wantedThe game is still heavilly in development but seeing the game was created by just 1 guy its really impressive. At first the game took ages to see updates but from what i know the dev employed some skilled helpers to bring the game up to speed and updates are more frequent now.The main thing I love about this game is that you play it at your pace. If you just want to chill and build a base you can however you have to haul materials or create a mine and processor and fabricate your own materials or you can just go out and live off the land and loot all the dead bodies you leave in your wake. :) If you like rpgs and like games where you can build and research I would def say this game is a must buy. Just keep in mind it is an early access game and bugs are expected :)
